comment: If you like to teach yourself then he is great. The only poistive is that you can take the tests and quizzes as many times as you want. During lectures he makes mistakes frequently. He goes on random tangents and when you don't understand he gets irritated.He replaced a lecture note grade with daily quizzes that don't pertain to what was taught tha

nice guy. makes mistakes while teaching so he gets corrected by the class frequently. all tests and assigned quizzes are online and open-book and can be taken multiple times. lots of homework. YOU CANT PROCRASTINATE and expect to do well. pop quizzes almost every day, but theyre easy. you need to be able to teach yourself. not a good morning class.

He's really a great guy. He does tend to make mistakes in his lectures and the class does tend to correct him. This class is a guarenteed A because all tests and quizzes are online and you can take them infinite times giving you the opportunity to make a 100. I would recommend him to any entering freshman looking for an easy math class.

He is a very good teacher who does everything possible to help you pass the class.  His lectures are not very clear and he does tend to make mistakes, but this forces you to read the book and study so you end up understanding the material even more. He gives a lot of extra credit and opportunities to raise your scores.  He is a very nice man.
I LOVE HIM! AWESOME GUY.

I was in his college algebra class and found he was very rude when I asked him for help no matter how small the help I requested was. His teacheing is of a very bad quality, your only chance is the online tests and quizzes unless he favors you.

Prof Mandt is a wonderful guy but I had to teach myself. When working problems out on the board, he does tend to make mistakes and it wastes class time. Attendance is mandatory. He gives a lot of extra credit. You get to take the tests away from class and you get 3 tries which saved me because math is not my strong suit.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!! He can't teach and he even told us "Sorry guys, my arithmetic isn't so great these days" AND he messes up on the board AT LEAST 5 times per class. We had to correct him or else he wouldn't even notice. If you have a question, don't bother asking, you'll just end up more confused. Don't waste your money, stay away!!
he is a vice man but quite vague and not very good at getting his point across
He can't really teach. He is not good at arithmetic, but if you already have a grasp of the subject or can teach yourself, it is super easy.

If you take this class be prepared to teach yourself precalculus. He is not very clear and often gets confused, confusing the entire class. He assigns a lot of homework, which is ok, but he does not do a good job of helping prepare for the work and test. The ONLY good thing about the class is that all test a quizes are online and can be taken over.

If you take this class be prepared to teach yourself precalculus. He is not very clear and often gets confused, confusing the entire class. He assigns a lot of homework, which is ok, but he does not do a good job of helping prepare for the work and test. The ONLY good thing about the class is that all test a quizes are online and can be taken over.
great guy

He is difficult to keep up with if you miss class. He gives you tons of bonus points and pop quizes to help your final average. I missed many days of class and explained what was going on and he would meet with me before class to help me with what I missed. If you try to keep up and do your homework there is no reason you shouldn't pass easily!!

For those who get distracted easily, this is not the class to take - especially in the morning.  I didn't find him very helpful, and if you miss a single class it's very difficult to catch up.  He never repeats important information concerning class meetings and getting in touch with him isn't simple.  I don't recommend him.
Bad

I didn't mind the class, but I enjoy math. If you have taken upper level math in high school, you'll be bored but you'll understand it. Gives a lot of bonus points and you end up getting bonus points for attentding class. It can be boring because he moves a bit slow, but guys..come on..it's school. What class isn't sometimes boring?

He is not always the best teacher, he sometimes gets confused and makes mistakes. However he is very fair and gives extra credit just for attending class. His quizzes are easy and the tests are a compilation of quiz questions.

He is a really nice guy, but he cannot teach. I'm sure HE understands what he is doing but he has a hard time teaching it. He constantly makes mistakes when he is teaching, so it's almost pointless to go to class. You get bonus points for not missing class, you get to use notes/quizzes/tests/anything besides the book, on your tests. So unless you a

Yes, he does sometimes have trouble with math (Google him to find out why), but he never let that affect our grades. He is beyond fair and will do anything to help you succeed in his class. It was so easy, but you have to show up for class because you take a quiz everyday (5 questions, multiple choice, EASY). I loved him!

helpful, but is NOT a good teacher. constantly making mistakes that lead to confusion in the classroom. open notes on tests/(daily) quizzes are helpful - must own book and do mymathlab in order to get anything out of this course.

Nice guy, but really cannot teach. We were constantly having to correct his board work and if you ask him a question, he goes off in his math world and no one knows what he's talking about. he's always willing to help, he just isn't very good at it. quizzes, tests and final are all open notes. i pretty much learned everything from mymathlab
